convivial.communism.server.example

Class ChatClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • convivial.communism.server.example.ChatClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ServerListener

    public class ChatClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements ServerListener
    This is an example class that implements ServerListener and uses a ServerConnection to read and send chat messages to other ChatClients. See the source code for more information.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ChatClient() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void connectToServer()
      Connects to the server, which needs to be entered as well as a specific port via terminal input.
      void disconnected()
      A method from the ServerListener interface, handles being disconnected from the server (either by the server or from a call to disconnect from the ServerConnection
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Starts up the ChatClient
      static void processConsoleInput()
      Performs commands based on what the user typed in.
      void receiveData(java.nio.channels.SelectionKey key, java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel, long bytesRead, java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
      The other method from ServerListener and handles receiving data from the server.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChatClient

        public ChatClient()

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Starts up the ChatClient

      • connectToServer

        public static void connectToServer()
        Connects to the server, which needs to be entered as well as a specific port via terminal input.

      • processConsoleInput

        public static void processConsoleInput()
        Performs commands based on what the user typed in. Only one command exists: quit, which causes a disconnection from the server thus returning to the loop in main where a connection to a server is asked for (or the user can enter quit again and close ChatClient).

      • disconnected

        public void disconnected()
        A method from the ServerListener interface, handles being disconnected from the server (either by the server or from a call to disconnect from the ServerConnection
        Specified by:
        disconnected in interface ServerListener

      • receiveData

        public void receiveData(java.nio.channels.SelectionKey key,
               java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel,
               long bytesRead,
               java.nio.ByteBuffer data)
        The other method from ServerListener and handles receiving data from the server. This method takes the byte data, puts it into a string, checks to see if the string contains \n, indicating a complete message.
        Specified by:
        receiveData in interface ServerListener
        Parameters:
        key - The Server's channel and its attached StringBuffer.
        channel - The server's channel.
        bytesRead - Number of bytes read into the ByteBuffer.
        data - Actual data transmitted (plain string).
